Plastic products would be made more environmentally friendly, as biodegradable plastics break down within a relatively short period without leaving toxic residues in the environment.
Plastic production would decrease as biodegradable plastics would be more cost-effective and have a reduced negative impact on the environment.
Biodegradable plastics would replace single-use plastics in various industries, such as packaging, food service, and waste management, leading to the reduction of plastic waste accumulation.
Biodegradable plastics would be a promising solution for reducing plastic waste in oceans, as they would decompose rapidly, preventing them from contributing to pollution and harming marine life.
Biodegradable plastics would open up new possibilities for innovation in packaging and product design, leading to the development of more sustainable and eco-friendly products.
